meanings.definition: To push, fold, or turn the edges or ends of something, especially in order to hide or secure them.
meanings.sent1: She tucked the blanket under the mattress to keep it in place.
meanings.sent2: The child tucked his toy neatly into the box.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tucked the ball of yarn under the couch.
meanings.sent4: He tucked away his emotions, hiding them from everyone.
meanings.sent5: The chef expertly tucked the filling into the pastry, creating a perfect seal.

meanings.definition: To put something into a small space or between two things.
meanings.sent1: She tucked her phone into her pocket before leaving the house.
meanings.sent2: He tucked the note between the pages of his book.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tucked the acorn into a tiny crevice in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The old house was tucked away between two tall buildings.
meanings.sent5: The explorer tucked the map into a waterproof pouch for safekeeping.

meanings.definition: To place something in a particular position, especially in a neat or secure way.
meanings.sent1: She tucked her hair behind her ears before starting the presentation.
meanings.sent2: He tucked the shirt neatly into his trousers.
meanings.sent3: The gardener tucked the flowers into the soil, creating a beautiful arrangement.
meanings.sent4: The author tucked a hidden message within the pages of the book.
meanings.sent5: The mother tucked her child into bed, ensuring they were cozy and warm.
